actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Armed Services.

official_title: A bill to amend titles 10 and 14, United States Code, to require a cadet or graduate of a military academy to refund a portion of the cost of his educational training received at the Academy, if he is separated by reason of conscientious objection before completing the course of instruction at the Academy or his active duty obligation.

summary.text: Requires a cadet or graduate of the United States Military, Naval, Air Force, or Coast Guard Academy to refund a portion of the cost of his educational training received at the Academy, if he is separated by reason of conscientious objection before completing the course of instruction at the Academy or his active duty obligation. (Amends 10 U.S.C. 4348(b) 9348(b), 6959(b); Amends 14 U.S.C. 182(b))

titles.title: A bill to amend titles 10 and 14, United States Code, to require a cadet or graduate of a military academy to refund a portion of the cost of his educational training received at the Academy, if he is separated by reason of conscientious objection before completing the course of instruction at the Academy or his active duty obligation.
